current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend the work opportunity credit for hiring veterans, and for other purposes.

text.#text:
Not later than 2 years after the date of the
			 enactment of this Act, and annually thereafter, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall pay to each
			 possession of the United States with a mirror code tax system amounts equal to
			 the loss to that possession by reason of the amendments made by this Act. Such
			 amounts shall be determined by the

based on
			 information provided by the government of the respective possession of the
			 United States.

shall pay to each
			 possession of the United States which does not have a mirror code tax system
			 the amount estimated by the

as being equal to the
			 loss to that possession that would have occurred by reason of the amendments
			 made by this Act if a mirror code tax system had been in effect in such
			 possession. The preceding sentence shall not apply with respect to any
			 possession of the United States unless such possession establishes to the
			 satisfaction of the Secretary that the possession has implemented (or, at the
			 discretion of the Secretary, will implement) an income tax benefit which is
			 substantially equivalent to the income tax credit in effect after the
			 amendments made by this Act.

text.#text:
The credit
			 allowed against United States income taxes for any taxable year under the
			 amendments made by this Act to

header.#text:
Coordination
			 with credit allowed against united states income taxes

term.#tail:
includes American Samoa, Guam, the
			 Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico,
			 and the United States Virgin Islands.

text.#text: For purposes of this section, the term

term.#tail:
means, with respect to any possession of the United States,
			 the income tax system of such possession if the income tax liability of the
			 residents of such possession under such system is determined by reference to
			 the income tax laws of the United States as if such possession were the United
			 States.

text.#text: For purposes of this section, the term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the payments under this section shall be treated in the same
			 manner as a refund due from credit provisions described in such section.
